intro: Carludovica jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican star apple, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica. It is a small, evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, star-shaped fruits that are sweet and fragrant. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
